content: The following lists events that happened during **1960 in Singapore**. ## Incumbents - [Yang di-Pertuan Negara](/wiki/Yang_di-Pertuan_Negara) – [Yusof Ishak](/wiki/Yusof_Ishak) - [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister) – [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ## Events ### February - 1 February – The [Housing and Development Board](/wiki/Housing_and_Development_Board) is set up by [Lim Kim San](/wiki/Lim_Kim_San), replacing the [Singapore Improvement Trust](/wiki/Singapore_Improvement_Trust). The Planning Authority takes over SIT's functions of land use in Singapore. ### July - 1 July – The [People's Association](/wiki/People%27s_Association) is formed. ### August - 28 August – 600 employees of the Singapore Glass Factory [go on a strike](/wiki/Singapore_Glass_Factory_strikes) lasting 73 days. ### September - 6 September – The [National Library](/wiki/National_Library,_Singapore) launches a new mobile library service. - 8 September – [Tan Howe Liang](/wiki/Tan_Howe_Liang) wins a silver medal during the [1960 Summer Olympics](/wiki/1960_Summer_Olympics). - 27 September- The Internal Security Council was formed ### November - 12 November – The [Old National Library Building](/wiki/Old_National_Library_Building) (demolished in 2004) was opened. ### Date unknown - [Far East Organization](/wiki/Far_East_Organization), a property developer was founded. - The [Primary School Leaving Examination(PSLE)](/wiki/Primary_School_Leaving_Examination) was first introduced as a mandatory examination in Singapore, the exam was meant for 12 years old who are leaving [Primary Schools](/wiki/Primary_school) and moving on into [Secondary Schools](/wiki/Secondary_school) ## Births - 7 January – [Hong Huifang](/wiki/Hong_Huifang), actress. - 24 January – [Jack Neo](/wiki/Jack_Neo), film director. - 17 March – [Ruth Langsford](/wiki/Ruth_Langsford), presenter in the [United Kingdom](/wiki/United_Kingdom). - 29 March – [Paddy Chew](/wiki/Paddy_Chew), actor (d. 1999). - 20 June – [Jeremy Monteiro](/wiki/Jeremy_Monteiro), singer. - 19 August – [Wee Siew Kim](/wiki/Wee_Siew_Kim), former politician. - 24 November – [Shirley Ng](/wiki/Shirley_Ng), sports shooter. - [Isa Kamari](/wiki/Isa_Kamari), author. ## Deaths - 25 March – Tan Theng Chiang, former legislative assemblyman for [Rochor Constituency](/wiki/Rochore_Constituency) (b. 1914). - 3 December – [John Laycock](/wiki/John_Laycock), lawyer and founder of the [Singapore Progressive Party](/wiki/Progressive_Party_(Singapore)) (b. 1887). - [List of years in Singapore](/wiki/List_of_years_in_Singapore) This Singapore-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: 1960 in Singapore
